recipe.detail: Cut pork, carrotsand potatoes into bite-sized pieces.

Heat the oil in a pan, at Chopped Onion and hopped garlic and fry over low heat until tender. Add the amount of water and the pork, carrots and potatos from 1 to medium heat. After boiling, reduce the heat to low and simmer until the vegetables are cooked.
Turn off the heat, at the curry roux and when the roux melts, put it on low heat again, add oyster sause and simmer for another four to five minutes.
Place rice on a plate and sprinkle 3
Finely chop the cabbage, sprinkle with salt and squeeze the water when it became soft.
Put minced meat, cabbage 1, green onions, Grated ginger, grated garlic, oyster sauce and Maru Chiken soup in a bowl and knead well until stickey to make ingredients.
Put the ingredients of 2 on the gyoza skin and wrap it in equzl parts.

Heat the oil in a frying pan, line up the dumping from 3 and bake them and add a brown color to the bottom. Add water(outside the amount) to half the height of the dumplings, cover and steam over medium to high heat for to 5minutes.
When the water is alomost gone, remove the water and take it out to a place when it is crispy
Cut the onions into 8 equal pieces and cut the carrots into 1.5cm wide gingo biloda. Cut the potatoes into 4 equal parts. Cut the potatoes into 3 cm lengths.
Heat the oil in a frying pan over medium heat, add the beef and fry. When the color of the meat changes, add the onions, carrots and potatoes in 1 in that order the and fly.

Add water and sake, remove the lye when boiling, cover and simmer on low heat for 10 minutes, add Hon-Dashi and Sugar and simmer for another 5 minutes. Add soy sauce and simmer for 5minutes. Add soy sauce and simmer for 5minutes without the lid. Boil the borth so that it returns from the bottom of the frying pan.
Serve in a bowl and sprinkle with the green beans from 1.
Cut chicken into bite-sized pieces. Put the chicken, Maru chicken broth, liquor, Grated ginger, Soy sauce and Pepper in a bowl and rub in ntil the juice is gone.
Put oil in a frying pan to a height of 3cm and heat to a low temperature(160℃).Immeiately before frying, soak Cake flour and potato starch in the chicken of 1 well and quickly put it in hot oil.
Turn upside down on the medium heat and fry for 3-4mintes, turn to high heat until the outside is crispy. Fry for about 1 mnute. Drain the oil the surface of the oil and remove it.
Cut the cabbage in half vertically, stack it, and cut it into small pieces.
Cut the carrots into thin slices vertically, stack several pieces, and cut into small pieces.Put in a bowl of water with cabbage. After about 5 minutes, raise it in a colander and drain it.
For pork, make 4 to 5 cuts at the boundary between lean meat and fat with the edge of a kitchen knife and cut the streaks.
Salt and pepper on both sides (when  is used as a base,the characteristic of the meat stands out)
Melt the egg in a vat. Sprinkle a thin layer of cake flour on the pork and sprinkle it on it.Beat off excess cake flour.
Batter the beaten egg and bread crumbs in that order.
Heat the oil to medium temperature (170-180 degrees), add (6) and return with chopsticks.
Fry for about 3 minutes. Bring to high heat and fry for another minute, remove and drain.
Cut the mackerel into 4 equal parts while inserting the knife diagonally. Make two shallow cuts in the vertical on the lenticel. Slice the green onions diagonally.

Put sliced ginger, water, liquor, sweet sake, sugar, soy sauce and hon-dashi  in a frying pan and heat it over high heat. After boiling, put the mackerel in (1) with the skin facing up, and simmer for about 1 minute while sprinkling the broth with a spoon.
When the color of the mackerel changes, adjust the heat so that the broth foams, cover it, and simmer for 5 minutes.
Dissolve half of the miso in the broth and add, and add the green onions from (1). Cover and simmer for about 2 minutes. Remove the lid, melt and add the remaining miso, and simmer until glossy.
Cut burdock root and carrot into small pieces. Cut the red karagarashi into small pieces, excluding the seeds.
Heat sesame oil in a pan and add half of (1) burdock, carrot, red karagarashi and Hon-dashi. Add and fry.
When the vegetables are tender, add water, the remaining Hon-Dashi, sugar, soy sauce, sweet sake and stir to make the juice succulent.Boil until it is gone.

name: Miso soup with cabbage and tofu

recipe.detail: Cut tofu into 1.5 cm squares. Cut cabbage into small pieces and carrots into small pieces. Cut the onion into combs.
Put water and hon-dashi in a pan and heat it. Add the tofu, cabbage, carrots and onions from (1) and simmer.
When the vegetables are tender, melt in the miso, warm until just before boiling, and turn off the heat.
Cut the bacon into strips. Add salt to plenty of hot water and display spaghetti on time.Boil and raise in a colander to drain. Save the boiled juice.
Put olive oil and bacon (1) in a frying pan and heat.Add spaghetti from (1), 1 cup of boiled juice, soy sauce, and Hon-Dashi.Serve in 3 bowls, grate radish and sprinkle with chopped paste.
Divide the tips of bamboo shoots into 6 to 8 pieces vertically. Cut the others into 1 cm thick slices and cut into 4 equal parts.
Put bamboo shoots water, Hon-dashi and (1) in a pan and let them boil for a while. Add sweet sake, soy sauce, season, cover with a drop lid and simmer for about 15 minutes.
Sprinkle the shavings on the finish, put it in a bowl, and decorate the tree buds as you like.

name: Easy in the microwave! potato salad

recipe.detail: Peel the potatoes, cut them into 1 cm wide ginkgo biloba, put them in a plate, sprinkle with water and consomme, cover with plastic wrap, and heat in a microwave oven (600 W) for 6 minutes. Steam for 5 minutes and crush roughly.
Cut the onion into thin slices and the cucumber into small pieces. Cut the ham in half and cut into 1 cm widths.
Put the onions and cucumbers from (2) in a bowl, sprinkle with a little salt (not included in the amount), and when it becomes soft, squeeze the water.
Put (1) potatoes, (2) ham, and (3) onions and cucumbers in another bowl, and add mayonnaise.Serve in 5 bowls and serve with salad vegetables.

name: Finish with a thick egg! Basic Oyakodon
ingredients.name: sweet sake
name: rice

recipe.detail: Cut chicken into 2 cm squares and slice onions into thin slices. Cut the mitsuba into 2 cm lengths.

Put water, Hon-Dashi, sugar, soy sauce, and mirin in a small frying pan and boil. Add the chicken and onions from (1) and simmer on medium heat for 3 minutes, sprinkle in the beaten egg, and simmer in a soft-boiled state.
Sprinkle half the amount on rice and sprinkle the brim of (1).
Break the egg into a bowl. Cut the green onions into small pieces.
Put water and flavor paste in a pan and heat it. Add the green onions from (1). After boiling, pour the egg liquid from (1) into a thread, turn off the heat, and mix gently with chopsticks.
Heat 1 tablespoon of oil in a frying pan, fry the onions until lightly colored and let cool. Combine the bread crumbs with milk and moisten.

Put minced meat, consomme and pepper in a bowl and mix well. Add the onion / bread crumbs and beaten egg from (1) and mix further. Divide it into 4 equal parts, shape it into an oval shape, and make a slight depression in the center.
Place the bean sprouts on a heat-resistant plate, sprinkle with consomme, cover with plastic wrap, and heat in a microwave oven (600W) for about 2 minutes and 30 seconds to mix.
Heat 2 tablespoons of oil in a frying pan, bake the seeds of (2) on high heat for 1 minute, turn over, cover and bake on low heat for 5 minutes.

Serve in a bowl and add bean sprouts, baby leaf and cherry tomatoes from (3). Add tomato ketchup, worcestershire sauce, sake and milk to the gravy left in the frying pan, boil and sprinkle on the hamburger steak.

Cut the potatoes into 4 equal parts. Cut the onions into combs and the carrots into small pieces. Divide the broccoli into small bunches and boil it down. Cut chicken into bite-sized pieces, season with salt, lightly roast in a frying pan, and remove.
In a pan, heat 1 tablespoon butter and oil over medium heat, add the onions from (1) and fry quickly. Add the potatoes from (1) and fry, add the carrots from (1), and fry until the oil is all over.
Turn off the heat, sprinkle in the flour, mix the whole, and fry over medium heat. Add milk, water, consomme and bay leaf and bring to a boil.
Boil the potatoes until they are cooked for 15 to 20 minutes, stirring them halfway so that the bottom does not burn.
Put the chicken back in (1), add salt and pepper, simmer for 5 minutes, and add broccoli, white wine, and 1 tablespoon butter from (1) to adjust the taste.
Cut onions, potatoes and carrots into cubes of about 1 cm. Expose the potatoes to water and wipe off the water. Garlic is finely chopped.
TWhen it is slightly colored, add the onions from (1) and fry on medium heat until tender. Add the carrots and potatoes from (1) in the order of canned tomatoes and fry for a while.
Add water and simmer on medium heat, remove the lye, reduce the heat to low, add
, cover and simmer for about 20 minutes. Adjust the taste with salt and pepper.
Cut sweet potatoes into 1 cm thick slices (half-moon slices if large) and expose to water to drain. Cut carrots and onions into thin slices, and cut bacon into 1 cm wide pieces.
Put butter and (1) sweet potatoes, carrots, onions and bacon in a pan and fry lightly. When the oil is all over, add A and simmer until the vegetables are tender.
Slice the potatoes into small pieces and slice the onions into thin slices.
Melt butter in a pan and fry the onions in (1) over low heat until clear. Add cake flour and fry further.
(1) Add the potatoes, water and consomme and heat over medium heat. After boiling, reduce the heat to low, cover and simmer for 30 minutes until the potatoes are soft.
In a pan, crush the potatoes with a whisk, add milk, and sprinkle with pepper.
Serve in a bowl and sprinkle with parsley.

ingredients.name: Cut small onions into small pieces

recipe.detail: Cut carrots into strips and garlic chives into zaku.
Put water and Chinese flavor in a pan and heat it. When it boils, add the carrots, garlic chives and wontons from (1) and let it boil for a while.
Serve in a bowl and sprinkle with small onions.

recipe.name: Chinese-style vermicelli soup with plenty of vegetables

recipe.detail: Cut the vermicelli in half with kitchen scissors. Cut carrots into strips and garlic chives into zaku.
Put water, whole chicken broth, and (1) vermicelli and carrots in a pan and heat them. When the vermicelli becomes soft, add (1) garlic and bean sprouts and simmer. When it's cooked, add
to taste.
Serve in a bowl and sprinkle with black pepper.

ingredients.name: Cut small onions into small pieces

recipe.detail: Eggplant is sliced into 5 to 6 mm wide slices and exposed to water to remove lye and drain. Cut carrots into chopped shimeji mushrooms and divide shimeji mushrooms into small bunches.
For deep-fried tofu, pour boiling water over it to drain the oil, cut it in half vertically, and cut it into 1 cm wide pieces.

Put water and 8g stick of Hon-Dashi Iriko Dashi in a pan and heat it. After boiling, add (1) eggplant, carrot, shimeji mushroom and (2) fried tofu and simmer. When the vegetables are tender, add the miso and let it boil for a while.
Serve in a bowl and sprinkle with small onions.

Cut the potatoes into 5 mm wide slices with the skin on and expose to water.Put potatoes and 1/4 cup of water (outside the amount) in a heat-resistant dish, wrap it, and wrap it.Heat in the microwave (600W) for about 8 minutes until the bamboo skewers pass smoothly.
Cut the onion into thin slices and the bacon into 1 cm width.
Heat 2 teaspoons of oil in a frying pan and bake both sides of the potatoes in (1) fragrantly.Sprinkle 1 teaspoon of consomme and take it out.
Heat 1 teaspoon of oil in the frying pan of (3), add the onions of (2) and fry quickly.Cover and steam over low heat for 3 minutes.
Add bacon from (2) and 1 teaspoon of consomme and fry, then add potatoes from (3).Put it back in and stir-fry, and add salt to taste.Serve in 6 bowls and sprinkle with parsley and pepper.
Cut the cucumber in half vertically and cut into 2 cm long pieces.Cherry tomatoes take calyx.
Make a cut in half the length of the avocado, remove the seeds, and remove the seeds.Peel and cut into 2 cm squares and sprinkle with lemon juice.
Mix
, olive oil, lemon juice, salt and pepper in a bowl to make a dressing.Add cucumbers and cherry tomatoes from (1) and avocado from (2) and serve in a bowl.
Peel the onions, cut them into 8 mm wide slices, and peel them off one by one.
Dissolve the eggs in a bowl, add flour, cold water, salt and pepper and mix to make a garment
Sprinkle the onions in (1) with flour and put on the batter in (2).
Heat the frying oil to medium temperature, add the onions from (3) one by one, and fry them while turning them over. Fry the rest in the same way.
Serve in a bowl and serve with mayonnaise and ketchup sauce.

recipe.name: Chinese cabbage and apple crispy salad

recipe.detail: Cut Chinese cabbage and apples into small pieces. Cut the shellfish cracked vegetables in half.
Put olive oil, lemon juice and grated ginger in a bowl and mix well. Add Chinese cabbage, apples and shellfish cracked vegetables from (1) and mix well.
Cut off the root of Mizuna and cut it into 3 cm long pieces. Tuna drains oil.
Slice the purple onion along the fiber and quickly expose it to water to drain it.
Put all ingredients in a bowl, mix well and serve in a bowl.

recipe.name: Bamboo shoots, chicken and rape blossoms

recipe.detail: Cut the boiled bamboo shoots into small pieces and boil them down.
Cut chicken into large bite-sized pieces.
Heat the oil in a pan and bake the chicken from (1) until it becomes golden brown on both sides.
Add the boiled bamboo shoots from (1) to (2), fry lightly, and add water, soy sauce, mirin, and Hon-Dashi.
If there is, remove it, cover it, and simmer it upside down until the broth is about half full.
Serve in 4 bowls and serve with salt-boiled rape blossoms.

recipe.name: Chinese soup of bamboo shoots and cabbage

recipe.detail: Cut the pork into bite-sized pieces, and slice the boiled bamboo shoots vertically.
Cut cabbage into 3 cm squares and cut carrots into strips.
Heat sesame oil in a pan, add the pork from (1) and fry.
When the color of the meat changes, add the boiled bamboo shoots, cabbage and carrots from (1) and fry.
When it becomes soft, add water, sake, whole chicken broth and soy sauce, and simmer for 2 to 3 minutes.
Cut bacon into 5 cm lengths. Rinse the rape blossoms in water, cut off the roots a little, peel off the hard part, and cut in half..
Broad beans are boiled in salt (outside the amount) and peeled.
Boil the spaghetti in water, consomme and salt for 5 minutes, leaving the boiled soup (cup 2).
Heat olive oil in a frying pan and fry the bacon and rape blossoms in (1).
When it becomes soft, add (2) spaghetti and boiled juice, (1) broad beans, and consomme and simmer for 1 minute.
Cut off the root of rape blossoms by about 5 mm.
Boil plenty of water in a pan, add salt and rape blossoms, and boil for about 1 minute (if you can't put it in the pan at once, boil it in 2 to 3 times).
Take it out into a bowl of water, let it cool, and squeeze out the water.
Cut rape blossoms into 3-4 cm lengths.
Put water, soy sauce, kneaded rice and Hon-dashi in a large bowl and mix.
Add rape blossoms to the bowl of 5 (4) and dare to serve in a bowl with chopsticks.
